Package de.unistuttgart.ils.aircraftsystemsarchitect.game.scenes.base

Class BaseGameFieldScene

java.lang.Object
de.unistuttgart.ils.aircraftsystemsarchitect.engine.graphics.scene.Scene
de.unistuttgart.ils.aircraftsystemsarchitect.game.scenes.base.BaseScene
de.unistuttgart.ils.aircraftsystemsarchitect.game.scenes.base.BaseGameFieldScene
Direct Known Subclasses:
BuildScene, GameScene
public abstract class BaseGameFieldScene extends BaseScene
this class can be used to inherit from to create the Build invalid input: '&' GameScene.

  • Method Details

    • addSimulationElement

      public void addSimulationElement(int x, int y, int imgId, float failureRatio, int correctSignalsNeeded, int outOfControlSignalsAccepted, boolean removable, float failureDetectionRatio)
      adds a SimulationEntity to the scene
      Parameters:
      x - : grid position at x
      y - : grid position at y
      imgId - : entity / image id
      failureRatio - : failure ratio of the entity
      removable - : can be removed or not

    • addToBuildPanel

      public void addToBuildPanel(int imgId, int amount, float failureRatio, int correctSignalsNeeded, int outOfControlSignalsAccepted, float failureDetectionRatio)
      add an Entity to the buildpanel
      Parameters:
      imgId - : the entity/img id
      amount - : how many times can this be built?
      failureRatio - : failure ratio of the entity

    • addGridElement

      public void addGridElement(int x, int y)
      add an Entity that snaps to the grid. This method can e.g. be called from the ResourceManager to parse the level.XML file to the actual GameScene. A GridComponent is added to the Entity to store the grid position data, which can be called to validate entities against each other without having to calculate their grid position based on the actual screen position.
      Parameters:
      x - : x position in the grid
      y - : y position in the grid
